column5: A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to: e.g. 131. Enter a integer number only.
A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to: de-identified. Free text - 200 characters.
Common name of the host: e.g. Human. Free text - 200 characters.
NCBI taxonomy idenifier e.g. 9606. Enter an integer number only.
Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study: e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees. Enter an integer number only - fill in units below.
Units for age given above. Free text. 20 Characters.
Height or length of sample. Enter a decimal number only - fill in units below.
Units for height or length given above. Free text - 20 characters.
Description of life stage of host. Free text - 200 characters.
The color of host. Free text - 100 characters.
Morphological shape of host. Free text - 100 characters.
Taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level. Free text - 200 characters.
Taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level: e.g. variety form rank etc. Free text - 100 characters.
The genotype. Free text - 200 characters.
Description of phenotype. Free text - 200 characters.
Total mass of the host at collection. Enter a decimal number only - fill in units below. The unit depends on host.
Units for mass entered above. Free text - 20 characters.
Total mass of the host after drying. Enter a decimal number only - fill in units below. The unit depends on host.
Units for mass entered above. Free text - 20 characters.
List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host. Free text - 2000 characters.
